intro: Buchnera parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered Buchnera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its small, tubular flowers are adapted for pollination by bees and other insects. Buchnera parviflora is often found in dry, open habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
